DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Less Than or Equal To Timepoint Post Scan Planned Start Date Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to whether or not the planned start date of surgery will be no later than after scans obtained.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Less Than or Equal To Timepoint Post Scan Planned Start Date
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device._The calendar date that an event or activity is intended to begin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Timepoint Post Scan Planned Start Date
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.:The calendar date that an event or activity is intended to begin.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.
The calendar date that an event or activity is intended to begin.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
